**Responsibilities:**



Are you driven to work within an innovation culture to derive value from data as we strive to make new medicines? Are you a strong collaborator that believes in the discipline of team science?



Lilly generates a large volume of biomedical data through discovery research and medicines development through clinical trials. There are also massive public data sets available that provide additional insight into disease and treatment areas of interest to Lilly. Data science and informatics plays a key role in driving actionable insights for discovering new medicines for our patients.

Research Informatics at Lilly is seeking a Research Scientist ? IT to join a newly formulated team ?Software and Analytics Engineering?. The ideal person will develop algorithms and machine learning techniques for a range of Lilly research problems with focus on clinical, longitudinal multi-omics datasets. This position will also entail development of a machine learning platform to allow collaboration and productionizing of analytics within Lilly Research Lab.



**Key Objectives/Deliverables:**



+ Develop and implement highly scalable computational and machine learning approaches to solve complex drug discovery business problems using research datasets

+ Develop and productionize a Machine Learning-As-A-Service platform to manage features and ML models for research

+ Participate as a technical and scientific lead on cross-functional research and IT teams. Drive the adoption of the machine platform by understanding use cases in Lilly Research

+ Influence and shape informatics strategy by providing regular inputs to projects, innovative computational methods and best software engineering practices in a changing research environment.
